Othertimes, I substituted BufferedXXX for the non buffered readers/input-streams.  The .read(buf) for the buffered versions has the "while loop" built in, according to the javadocs. UIMA-284 move test that leads to a wait inside the same lock used for the wait to eliminate the race condition:  the test being true, then a thread switch which makes the test false also issues the notify, followed by a thread switch back to the original which then waits (perhaps indefinately) for the notify which has (in this hypothetical case) been already issued.

UIMA-284.  3 fixes.  1) added volatile to fields in this class not otherwise under synch locks for read/writing, where the fields are set/read on different threads.  Without this, different threads can see different values for these because the JVM may keep the value of these in "registers" local to the thread.

This is a repackaging of just the tooling part of uima-docbooks.  uima-docbooks will be reworked to make use of this.  The new packaging supports multiple versions of docbook xml, docbook xsl, saxon, fop, and jai.  It also now will no longer have these components in the project, but will offer to download them for the user the first time they're needed.  A limited amount of logic to bypass parts of docbook processing not needed because targets are up to date has been added, more to come.

This is a repackaging of just the tooling part of uima-docbooks.  uima-docbooks will be reworked to make use of this.  The new packaging supports multiple versions of docbook xml, docbook xsl, saxon, fop, and jai.  It also now will no longer have these components in the project (except for fop), but will offer to download them for the user the first time they're needed.  A limited amount of logic to bypass parts of docbook processing not needed because targets are up to date has been added, more to come.

Fix: for calls to multiprocessorEngine's "process(cas, result-spec)" and the trace form, override this method in the super to 1) check out an instance of the ae, 2) set the result spec on it, 3) call the process method on that ae, and then release the ae back to the pool.  For setResultSpec calls, get the ae's one at a time, set the result spec, and release back to the pool.

[UIMA-607]Change the PearAnalysisEngineWrapper to reuse resource managers it creates, where the classPath, dataPath, and "application" are the same.  This typically arises when running a CPM pipeline with replication.  An application is the set of components using the same outside-of-the-pear resource manager.  A weak hash-map is used to map from this outside-of-the-pear resource manager to the created resource manager for this pear, so that when the application finishes (and is GC'ed) these resources are GC'd too.  This won't happen for the special case where no external resource manager is being used (in this case, the outside-of-the-pear resource manager is "null"), but that's OK, since multiple applications are not being run in the same JVM in this case, anyway.

[UIMA-832] update to 2.2.2.  Added an ant script in uimaj-distr ... / build/changeVersion.xml and a versions.properties file, to do most of the work of changing the versions.  Some things not automated, but for those, the script echos a message to remind what need changing manually.  Some of the POMs have an xml comment added to the line the script is to change, to improve the chances of the script avoiding to change the wrong thing.  The script always checks for the "previous" value, and only updates if it finds that.   So it can be run repeatedly without harm.

[UIMA-739] This change fixes the update site build so that the build includes previous versions of the features.  This allows the users of the Eclipse Update site to find and download previous versions, should that be needed.  Previous versions of the plugins are kept on the apache.org/dist/incubator/uima/eclipse-update-site.  Previous versions of the feature jars (these are very small) are kept in SVN, because it allows building when disconnected from the internet (otherwise, they would need to be downloaded from apache.org/dist).  They are kept in the top level "features" folder of the update-site project.  This folder's svn:ignore setting is removed in this change.  As part of the release process, committers should check in the non-SNAPSHOT versions of new builds when releases are done (I'll update our web-site).

[UIMA-739] delete the -SNAPSHOT versions of new features from the "features" dir, to avoid making the uimaj-eclipse-update-site project marked as needing an SVN update, unless the non-snapshot version is being generated.

[UIMA-951] Specify maven-bundle-plugin version 1.4.0 for all uses, which enables new level of BND which supports new instruction <_nouses>true</_nouses> which prevents the generation of "uses" clauses in the exports, which Eclipse 3.2 doesn't support.  Also, even for 3.3 there is a performance issue using "uses", see: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/stp-dev/msg01624.html. [UIMA-1840] ResultSpecification_impl has new static method that takes 2 ResultSpec_impls and intersects them, following language subsumption rules.  The Javadocs for containsType and containsFeature are clarified to represent what they do in all the specific cases of language subsumption.  The PrimitiveAnalysisEngine_impl is modified to cache the resultSpec corresponding to its output capabilities, everytime the type system changes. The call to do the intersection is changed to use the new method in the ResutlSpecification_impl.  The old method, computeAnalysisComponentResultSpec, is commented out.  I hope no users made use of this (we'll soon see ...).  I made a new set of test cases for this (ResultSpecTest), and moved the resultSpec test from the AnalysisEngine_implTest, and modified it to work (it needs the type system specified, in order to compute the intersection for these tests).

[UIMA-1834] added a new class, UimaVersion and UimaAsVersion, which is not in the source-path, and has substitutable values for the version (major, minor, incremental), and updated the pom to use filtered resource processing to produce a new class under target which has the version info from the pom substituted in.

[UIMA-1840] Implement a valid equals method for resultSpecs - old method only tested 2 of the fields (was defaulting from a superclass). This equals method is used in the test case to compare actual and expected result specs.  Implement a hashcode that throws unsupported operation, since computing a true hashcode is very expensive and isn't done. One test broke in AnalysisEngine_implTest - where it compared the ResultSpec sent in (which had a type with language x-unspecified), with the resultSpec sent to the last primitive (which had an output capability of "en" for that type) - which made the result spec there != to the one sent in (it was "narrowed" to "en").

[UIMA-1846, UIMA-1847] removing executions - not needed, reduce clutter. Fix the use of Require-Bundle - the extra blanks in front of the lines in the POM used to align these there were showing up in the manifest, and if there were enough of them, the manifest stopped working when it was loaded by Eclipse.  Also, needed to add org.eclipse.core.runtime to the Require-Bundle set, and excluded it correspondingly (as required by OSGi) from the <Import-Package> list.  Otherwise the generated manifest would be missing things. This change happened when a later version of the maven-bundle-plugin upgraded the way manifest entries were built.

[UIMA-1722] Change CasCreationUtils part where to get metadata info, it instantiates (produceResource) a resource, gets the meta data info, and then destroys the resource - to cache these for 30 -60 seconds, to avoid repeatedly doing this for the same resource, since it can be very expensive (e.g., if the resource is a "custom Resource Specifier" used to denote a UIMA-AS remote service, this entails setting up a connection to that remote resource, and querying it, etc.). [UIMA-3759] Using profiler, determined that the test driver is holding on to instances of the test classes.  If those classes, in turn, have instance variables holding onto large objects, and no tearDown() sets these to null, this causes an accum. of memory use.
